summary:
## Men's Rugby World Cup: A Quick Look

The Rugby World Cup is a big rugby tournament held every four years. The best international teams compete to become world champions and win the Webb Ellis Cup. It started in 1987 and has been won by South Africa, New Zealand, Australia, and England. The tournament used to have 16 teams, then 20, and will have 24 teams in 2027. There's also a separate Women's Rugby World Cup.
title: Rugby World Cup
